abstract: Ross Douthat Op-Ed column suggests that Americans should feel sympathy for King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia, despite fact that he presided over repressive and wicked regime; argues that Abdullah was beholden to system that he inherited, much like past three United States presidents have been in their approach to post-Cold War Middle East, even if he was nominally interested in changing country's direction.
lead_paragraph: A monarch is dead, but our relationship with his gangster family is not.
snippet: A monarch is dead, but our relationship with his gangster family is not.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

headline.seo: King Abdullah and the United States
